answers: Neo-expressionism [or Junge Wilde or Neue Wilden in Germany; or Transavantgarde or Transavanguardia in Italy]
parts: Name this 1980s art movement that emphasized gesturalism as a response to the glut of conceptual art. In America, it was represented by Eric Fischl’s depictions of suburbia and Julian Schnabel’s plate paintings.

Julian Schnabel also directed a documentary about this fellow Neo-expressionist street artist, who began his career as part of the duo SAMO (“SAME-oh”) in New York and later collaborated with Andy Warhol and Keith Haring.
Basquiat’s Neo-expressionist style was influenced by his early career using this medium, also used by Banksy for his satirical and often stenciled street art.

answers: unit cells [accept primitive cells; prompt on cells]
parts: Name these constructs which are the smallest repeating sections of a crystal. A simple cubic crystal has the equivalent of one atom packed into every one of these, while a body-centered cubic has two.

In a perfect cubic crystal, there are three planes which run parallel to one axis of a unit cell but intersect the other two at 45 degrees. Name any of those three planes, expressing your answer in reduced Miller indices.

The unit cells with the highest packing efficiency are the face-centered cubic and a “close-packed” one where the top and bottom of the cell have this shape. Lonsdaleite and wurtzite have lattices with this shape.

Name this Black Sea country whose feared Committee for State Security assisted in the assassination of dissident writer Georgi Markov with a ricin-tipped umbrella. Simeon II briefly ruled this country from Sofia.

This Bulgarian leader ordered the assassination of Georgi Markov. The longest-serving Eastern Bloc leader, this man forced Turks to take Bulgarian names and encouraged subordinates to practice predanost.

This father of Simeon II recovered Bulgarian losses in the Treaty of Neuilly by allying with the Axis. Ministers such as Dimitar Peshev and Exarch Stephen pressured him to rescue Bulgarian Jews from deportation to the Holocaust.
This type of effect occurs to those in the control group of an experiment. Participants improve despite receiving a fake version of the treatment.
For people in an experiment, learning that they are in an experiment could cause this type of effect, whereby expected results are altered due to participants knowing that they are being monitored.

In experiments where samples might not have been chosen randomly, this statistical technique is used to correct the bias by combining the sampling probability of each observation with the conditional expectation of the dependent variable.

answers: little-endian or big-endian or endianness [prompt on LSB or MSB]
parts: Guido van Rossum named this whitespace-using, dynamically typed language after an absurdist British comedy troupe. It is frequently used for its "num" and "sci" libraries.
This Python library for web scraping is an HTML/XML parser designed to work even with malformed data. It is named for a song sung by the Mock Turtle in Alice in Wonderland.

This concept, the ordering of bytes within a multi-byte number, comes in two types: putting the least significant byte or the most significant byte first. It is named for two factions who war over the best way to break eggs in Gulliver's Travels.
